bestBHT.bht: Why sleep ye? This reproach from Luke emphasizes the disciples' failure to stay awake during Jesus' important prayer time. This serves as a reminder of the need for spiritual alertness, particularly when faced with temptations. Jesus urges them to rise and pray to avoid falling into temptation.

Archibald T. Robertson: Why sleep ye? (Τ καθευδετε;). This reproach Luke gives, but not the almost bitter details in Mark 14:37-42; Matthew 26:40-46).
John Gill: And said unto them, why sleep ye?....
Rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

bhtAttempts.bht: Why sleep ye? This reproach from Luke highlights the disciples' inability to stay awake during Jesus' crucial moments of prayer before his arrest. While Luke does not provide the intense details found in other accounts, the question itself serves as a wake-up call. It reminds us of the disciples' need to be vigilant and spiritually aware, especially in the face of impending temptation. Jesus urges them to rise and pray, emphasizing the importance of communion with God to resist giving in to temptation.
